arts.ttl: Manchester City vs. Borussia Dortmund: UEFA Champions League LIVE blog and team news
arts.sum: With seven points from three games in this season's UEFA Champions League, Niko Kovač's Borussia Dortmund will be quietly confident of getting a result at Manchester City on Wednesday (kick-off: 9pm CET). Dortmund's unbeaten start to the 2025/26 campaign was ended by Bundesliga leaders Bayern Munich a fortnight ago, but they've won all four competitive games since, including a 4-2 victory at Copenhagen in their last Champions League fixture.

arts.ttl: Dortmund must stop 'outstanding' Haaland, asserts Gross
arts.sum: Erling Haaland could become the first player to score in five consecutive Champions League appearances for three different clubs.

arts.ttl: Man City Predicted Lineup vs. Borussia Dortmund: Haaland Hoping to Torment Former Club
arts.sum: Pep Guardiola’s side have two wins and a draw to date in the 2025–26 Champions League.

arts.ttl: Manchester City vs Borussia Dortmund predictions: Citizens can best BVB in a thriller
arts.sum: Jamie Griffith is expecting Manchester City to overcome Borussia Dortmund in a high-scoring Champions League contest on Wednesday.

arts.ttl: Manchester City vs Borussia Dortmund – ‘Good news’ for German side, ‘crucial’ player trains on Tuesday
arts.sum: Borussia Dortmund have been handed a major boost ahead of their clash against Manchester City. Defender Nick Schlotterbeck is back fit for the German side. That’s according to BILD, who report that Dortmund have been handed ‘good news’ ahead of the Champions League clash at the Etihad. arts.ttl: Manchester City vs Borussia Dortmund Prediction: Will Erling Haaland Haunt his Former Club?
arts.sum: We look ahead to Wednesday's UEFA Champions League game with our Manchester City vs Borussia Dortmund prediction and preview. The post Manchester City vs Borussia Dortmund Prediction: Will Erling Haaland Haunt his Former Club? appeared first on Opta Analyst.

arts.ttl: Pep Guardiola takes unprecedented step and gives Man City stars the DAY OFF - despite playing in the Champions League against Borussia Dortmund tomorrow
arts.sum: The decision is believed to have been made to keep legs fresh ahead of their fourth game of the competition and Guardiola has been consistent in his complaints at the packed fixture schedule.
